basics.name: Zubair Zafar
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

work.name: Etihad Aviation Group, Abu Dhabi
work.summary: Worked as a Sofware Engineer in Cargo Department.

volunteer.position: Section Leader at Code in place
volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Led a group of students as a Section Leader at Code in Place Stanford, providing guidance and mentorship throughout the online programming course.
Conducted weekly section meetings, fostering interactive discussions, and addressing students' questions and concerns to enhance their understanding of programming concepts.
Reviewed and provided constructive feedback on assignments and projects, ensuring students' mastery of coding skills and adherence to best practices.
Organized and facilitated collaborative coding sessions, promoting teamwork and problem-solving abilities among students.
Acted as a liaison between students and course staff, effectively communicating information, addressing inquiries, and resolving issues promptly to ensure a smooth learning experience.

volunteer.summary: Business and Tech Mentor at lablab.ai hackathons
highlights: Facilitated team formation and provided mentorship to hackathon participants.
Guided teams in accessing APIs and integrating external services into their projects.
Assisted in refining project ideas and coached teams' in effective pitching.
Collaborated with other mentors to create a supportive and inclusive environment.
Supported teams throughout the hackathon, addressing technical challenges and ensuring timely submissions.
Organized a weekly webinar series, inviting accomplished professionals to deliver technical talks and share their expertise with the community.
Moderated the Data Structures and Algorithms session, guiding participants in solving LeetCode questions and facilitating a collaborative learning environment.
Took charge of identifying and moderating students for participation in high-quality hackathons, ensuring their readiness and suitability for the events.
Served as a teacher for IELTS classes, delivering instruction and support to students for a period of two months.
Demonstrated strong organizational skills in coordinating and managing various activities related to technical sessions, webinars, hackathons, and language classes.

education.institution: Government College University Faisalabad, Sahiwal, Pakistan

awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
